pr_title: [netatmo] Add support for the Presence camera (#3059)

timeline.bodyText:
Why NOC ???
Why not something like NAPresence ?
timeline.author: lolodomo

replies.bodyText: "NOC" is a type id which comes from the Netatmo API, I can't change that. ;-) At least the constant name is more meaningful. It seems to mean "Netatmo Outdoor Camera", see https://dev.netatmo.com/apidocumentation/security#products-details
replies.author: Novanic

replies.bodyText:
We have the full control / choice of our openHAB thing types.
As I understand, until now the OH thing type is matching the API type ?
There was no real reason for that and as soon as this type has no easy meaning for the end user, I would suggest to use a more meaning thing type, like OutdoorCamera for example.
And it was a bad idea to use uppercase letters in the thing types. But it is too late to change that.
replies.author: lolodomo

replies.bodyText:
"NOC" has technically to match the Netatmo API type, there is no other mapping mechanizm within the binding.
Yes, Netatmo changed their product names. "Welcome" is now "Indoor", and "Presence" is now "Outdoor". I decided to keep the old names, because everything is named "Welcome", now it is still consistent. I think it would be a good idea to plan a separate refactoring issue to rename everything to the new names, "Welcome" is existing in nearly every class, so that will become expensive and should planned separately.
replies.author: Novanic

replies.bodyText:
"NOC" has technically to match the Netatmo API type

Can you please point in the code where it is required to have the openHAB thing type being named "NOC" to be able to use the API ?
replies.author: lolodomo

replies.bodyText: Method "org.openhab.binding.netatmo.internal.discovery.NetatmoModuleDiscoveryService#discoverWelcomeHome", line 149. When you follow the trace you will find method "org.openhab.binding.netatmo.internal.discovery.NetatmoModuleDiscoveryService#findThingUID", there it is matched with the constants. See also the usage of method "io.swagger.client.model.NAWelcomeCamera#getType", there comes "NOC" from the Netatmo API like described in the API documentation from Netatmo.
replies.author: Novanic

replies.bodyText: Ok, you're absolutely right ! I don't like how it was done but it makes sense in this case to continue with the same patten and so use NOC as thing type in openHAB.
replies.author: lolodomo

timeline.bodyText:
In case we decide to have only one configuration setting for any camera, at least its label and description has to be updated (not its name as it will break existing setup).
But I rather suggest to add a new configuration setting readPresence.
timeline.author: lolodomo

replies.bodyText:
Thank you for your feedback.
I decided for the first option (renaming just label and description), because I think there is no use-case for enabling indoor camera access but not outdoor camera access or the other way round. I renamed it to generally "Access Camera API", that should it clarify for the user, it's downward compatible and nobody has to activate the Presence separately.
I hope the solution is ok. When necessary I could also revert it and separate the settings.
replies.author: Novanic

replies.bodyText: Update: Hm, maybe it's better to separate it. It would cause that the user automatically grants more scopes when the binding is already installed, right? So it would be better when the user explicitly set the grants for the new scopes. I will separate it, please block the pull-request since the change is done.
replies.author: Novanic

replies.bodyText: done. It is now separated, the user has to grant the access to the outdoor cameras explicitly.
replies.author: Novanic

timeline.bodyText:
Please rename the file into camera.xml for example as it now contains the description of several camera.
Why NOC ???
timeline.author: lolodomo

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: Novanic

timeline.bodyText: Could be renamed into thing-type:netatmo:camera for example (in the 2 thing types).
timeline.author: lolodomo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -27,6 +27,29 @@
 		<config-description-ref uri="thing-type:netatmo:nawelcomecamera"/>
 	</thing-type>
 
+	<thing-type id="NOC">
+		<supported-bridge-type-refs>
+			<bridge-type-ref id="netatmoapi" />
+		</supported-bridge-type-refs>
+
+		<label>Presence Camera</label>
+		<description>This represents a presence camera at home</description>
+
+		<channels>
+			<channel id="welcomeCameraStatus" typeId="status"></channel>
+			<channel id="welcomeCameraSdStatus" typeId="sd_status"></channel>
+			<channel id="welcomeCameraAlimStatus" typeId="alim_status"></channel>
+			<channel id="welcomeCameraIsLocal" typeId="is_locale"></channel>
+			<channel id="welcomeCameraLivePicture" typeId="live_picture"></channel>
+			<channel id="welcomeCameraLivePictureUrl" typeId="live_picture_url"></channel>
+			<channel id="welcomeCameraLiveStreamUrl" typeId="live_stream_url"></channel>
+			<channel id="welcomeHomeEvent" typeId="homeEvent"></channel>
+		</channels>
+
+		<representation-property>id</representation-property>
+		<config-description-ref uri="thing-type:netatmo:nawelcomecamera" />

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: Novanic

timeline.bodyText: Does this change effect existing users?
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText:
That is a good question.
How can this change affect existing users ? You think the config url is stored in the JSON database ?
replies.author: lolodomo

replies.bodyText: IIRC it will not. We are persisting the Thing configuration. Not the config descriptions.
replies.author: cweitkamp

replies.bodyText:
Hm, I'm not sure. Are you sure enough?
When not I think we have to revert that (but it is a result of a code review from lolodomo) or we have to test/confirm that (but I'm missing a Welcome camera which would necessary to test that).
replies.author: Novanic

timeline.bodyText: It maybe will be a little bit confusing for users to have the "welcome" prefix on their channels.
timeline.author: cweitkamp
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -24,7 +24,30 @@
 		</channels>
 
 		<representation-property>id</representation-property>
-		<config-description-ref uri="thing-type:netatmo:nawelcomecamera"/>
+		<config-description-ref uri="thing-type:netatmo:camera"/>
+	</thing-type>
+
+	<thing-type id="NOC">
+		<supported-bridge-type-refs>
+			<bridge-type-ref id="netatmoapi" />
+		</supported-bridge-type-refs>
+
+		<label>Presence Camera</label>
+		<description>This represents a presence camera at home</description>
+
+		<channels>
+			<channel id="welcomeCameraStatus" typeId="status"></channel>

replies.bodyText: Good catch.
replies.author: lolodomo

replies.bodyText: cameraStatus would be better.
replies.author: lolodomo

replies.bodyText:
Hm, I think I can't just rename it. Actual Welcome and Presence use the same API, so "Welcome" should get removed it the whole code base. When I start to rename these channels ...

only for Presence to "presenceCameraStatus": I have to duplicate at least class NAWelcomeCameraHandler. The next thing is NAWelcomeCamera which comes from the swagger-api project and there are many many more naming problems like this.
for Welcome and Presence to "cameraStatus": It isn't downward compatible.

I see the point that it may be confusing for the user that the channels are named with "welcome". It would be ok for me to realize the 1. solution but this has to stop at NAWelcomeCameraHandler. I can't refactor the whole code base with this pull-request... ;-) So I would suggest to create a new refactoring issue to resolve this. At this point at least the user doesn't recognize the naming problems and the later refactoring can also be downward compatible.
replies.author: Novanic

replies.bodyText: Renaming internal classes is not the problem. It does not (really) affect a user. I do not want you to refactor all the stuff right now. We should use general naming for new channels to make them reusable. I read about a Netatmo video doorbell coming soon which will have a camera too. Touching existing channels for Welcome will be a breaking change. In my POV we can leave them untouched at the moment.
replies.author: cweitkamp

replies.bodyText: So what are we doing there ? Keep the channel names with "welcome" in the new thing type for presence camera ? Or remove welcome from the channel names only in the new presence thing typ, keeping the channel names with welcome in the welcome thing type for backward compatibility ?
replies.author: lolodomo

replies.bodyText: I have now pushed new changes which use "camera"... channels instead of "welcomeCamera"... channels. That required new mapping code and an inheritance structure at one class. You can decide what's the better solution, I could also revert it again. ;-)
replies.author: Novanic

replies.bodyText: I would prefer if we kept backward compatibility so this change can be released in the 2.5.x branch. Otherwise this can't be merged until openHAB 3 is released.
replies.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: Novanic

timeline.bodyText: Can you please add few spaces in the first column to compensate the suppress of welcome ?
timeline.author: lolodomo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -483,10 +489,17 @@ All these channels are read only.
 | welcomeCameraLivePictureUrl | String    | Url of the live snapshot for this camera                 |
 | welcomeCameraLiveStreamUrl  | String    | Url of the live stream for this camera                   |
 
-All these channels are read only.
+**Supported channels for the Presence Camera thing:**
 
-Warning : the URL of the live snapshot is a fixed URL so the value of the channel welcomeCameraLivePictureUrl will never be updated once first set by the binding.
-So to get a refreshed picture, you need to use the refresh parameter in your sitemap image element.
+| Channel ID                  | Item Type | Description                                              |
+|-----------------------------|-----------|----------------------------------------------------------|
+| cameraStatus         | Switch    | State of the camera                                      |
+| cameraSdStatus       | Switch    | State of the SD card                                     |
+| cameraAlimStatus     | Switch    | State of the power connector                             |
+| cameraIsLocal        | Switch    | indicates whether the camera is on the same network than the openHAB Netatmo Binding |
+| cameraLivePicture    | Image     | Camera Live Snapshot                                     |
+| cameraLivePictureUrl | String    | Url of the live snapshot for this camera                 |
+| cameraLiveStreamUrl  | String    | Url of the live stream for this camera                   |

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: Novanic

timeline.bodyText:
UnDefType.NULL should never be set. Please rather use UnDefType.UNDEF.
Can you fix the other methods in the class please ? I see the same error at line 96 for example.
timeline.author: lolodomo

replies.bodyText: Ok, I have just realized the same behavior like the other methods. I can change that when you are sure. I hope this pull-request is not a never ending story... ;-)
replies.author: Novanic

replies.bodyText: done (but I have only changed it for toOnOffType methods because there are too many usages and I can't ensure that nothing would break. That could be a good separate refactoring ;-))
replies.author: Novanic

timeline.bodyText: Just a comment, I see the scope "write_camera" is used for the Welcome camera. I don't remember what it is its role. But are you sure that it is not required for the Presence ?
timeline.author: lolodomo

replies.bodyText: Yes, write_camera isn't existing for the Presence camera. This is documented here: https://dev.netatmo.com/apidocumentation/security#scopes
replies.author: Novanic

timeline.bodyText: Do we keep this channel with this name ?
timeline.author: lolodomo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -24,7 +24,30 @@
 		</channels>
 
 		<representation-property>id</representation-property>
-		<config-description-ref uri="thing-type:netatmo:nawelcomecamera"/>
+		<config-description-ref uri="thing-type:netatmo:camera"/>
+	</thing-type>
+
+	<thing-type id="NOC">
+		<supported-bridge-type-refs>
+			<bridge-type-ref id="netatmoapi" />
+		</supported-bridge-type-refs>
+
+		<label>Presence Camera</label>
+		<description>This represents a presence camera at home</description>
+
+		<channels>
+			<channel id="cameraStatus" typeId="status"></channel>
+			<channel id="cameraSdStatus" typeId="sd_status"></channel>
+			<channel id="cameraAlimStatus" typeId="alim_status"></channel>
+			<channel id="cameraIsLocal" typeId="is_locale"></channel>
+			<channel id="cameraLivePicture" typeId="live_picture"></channel>
+			<channel id="cameraLivePictureUrl" typeId="live_picture_url"></channel>
+			<channel id="cameraLiveStreamUrl" typeId="live_stream_url"></channel>
+			<channel id="welcomeHomeEvent" typeId="homeEvent"></channel>

replies.bodyText: As I understand the events are reported to the WelcomeHome thing. Actually I haven't tested the channel and events of the Presence are useless at the moment, because sub events are missing within the retrofit Swagger mapping. I'm working on it separately as I mentioned in issue #3059. I think I will remove this channel for the moment and realize and test it with a separate issue later.
replies.author: Novanic

replies.bodyText: Yes because that would have no sense to present a channel which is never set.
replies.author: lolodomo

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: Novanic

timeline.message:
Support for the Presence camera added

Signed-off-by: Sven Strohschein <sven.strohschein@gmail.com>

README updated for Presence camera support

Signed-off-by: Sven Strohschein <sven.strohschein@gmail.com>

Files and thing types renamed because it handles now various camera types (not only the Welcome camera)

Signed-off-by: Sven Strohschein <sven.strohschein@gmail.com>

Permission configurations renamed because it handles now various camera types (not only the Welcome camera)

Signed-off-by: Sven Strohschein <sven.strohschein@gmail.com>

README updated to clarify the Welcome and Presence product names

Signed-off-by: Sven Strohschein <sven.strohschein@gmail.com>

Permission configurations renamed because it handles now various camera types (not only the Welcome camera) ; Reverted. Now it is separated, so the user has explicitly to decide if he wants to grant the access to outdoor cameras.

Signed-off-by: Sven Strohschein <sven.strohschein@gmail.com>

Camera channels separated to remove "welcome" from the (Presence) channel names. The channels of the Welcome camera were not renamed to be downward compatible.

Signed-off-by: Sven Strohschein <sven.strohschein@gmail.com>

Camera channels separated to remove "welcome" from the (Presence) channel names. The channels of the Welcome camera were not renamed to be downward compatible.

Signed-off-by: Sven Strohschein <sven.strohschein@gmail.com>

README format fixed

Signed-off-by: Sven Strohschein <sven.strohschein@gmail.com>

README format fixed

Signed-off-by: Sven Strohschein <sven.strohschein@gmail.com>

NULL changed to UNDEF like mentioned within the code review

Signed-off-by: Sven Strohschein <sven.strohschein@gmail.com>

welcomeHomeEvent channel removed for the Presence camera, event handling for the Presence will get realized later

Signed-off-by: Sven Strohschein <sven.strohschein@gmail.com>
